title: PowerGlove
author: PowerGlove
content: So, I found this piece of code while poking around SMF (testing the new [r] tag I'm working on):Code:// You are not!if (isset($_POST['message']) && strtolower($_POST['message']) == 'i am the administrator.' && !$user_info['is_admin']) fatal_error('Knave! Masquerader! Charlatan!', false);Basically, if you try to post (or later edit) a message containing nothing but the (case-insensitive, unquoted) string "i am the administrator.", you'll (in all probability) be greeted with the following:Anyway, just a small bit of fun that I thought would be worth sharing.

comments.author: shahzadafzal
comments.body: Nice finding and yes it's working or say not working.... But what's the meaning of "Knave! Masquerader! Charlatan!" and Which language is it?

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: shahzadafzal on May 09, 2023, 07:06:35 AMWhich language is it?English

comments.author: shahzadafzal
comments.body: Quote from: Xal0lex on May 09, 2023, 07:13:52 AMEnglish Ha! that's one hell of a English I can't even say it without stumbling, except for the word Charlatan! Hahaha, good one!

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: shahzadafzal on May 09, 2023, 07:22:17 AMQuote from: Xal0lex on May 09, 2023, 07:13:52 AMEnglish Ha! that's one hell of a English I can't even say it without stumbling, except for the word Charlatan! Hahaha, good one! How about this? Is that better? Makar! Daghabaz! Dhokay baz!

comments.author: shahzadafzal
comments.body: Quote from: Xal0lex on May 09, 2023, 07:42:20 AMHow about this? Is that better? Makar! Daghabaz! Dhokay baz!hahaha damnn bro... got it that' perfect

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Theymos can say: "i am the administrator."And I can post it with quotes

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on May 09, 2023, 12:53:03 PMTheymos can say: "i am the administrator."And I can post it with quotes Let me test if I can lie say that I am also the administrator, without quotes

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: An updated and easier version for the English speakers.Code:rogue! impostor! fraud!By the way if someone tried something suspicious than the words suit that person very well! That's why never attempt such things that could add those words in your portfolio.

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Quote from: PowerGlove on May 09, 2023, 06:54:33 AM But this not English Language, When I saw the topic I was even thinking that you are taken about some sort of foreign language or user names and unknown to me that, you are talking of codes. Well it was a nice tour from your site as the one of the forum engineers. It anyone who can interprete the words to English language, it will be a great help to the none native speakers in the forum. Is it that "I am the administrator" is the meaning?Quote from: Xal0lex on May 09, 2023, 07:13:52 AMQuote from: shahzadafzal on May 09, 2023, 07:06:35 AMWhich language is it?English  English? From which country that such old words are still used in this present days?

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.created_time: May 11, 2023, 05:34:15 AMLast edit: May 11, 2023, 06:11:44 AM by Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on May 10, 2023, 04:48:41 PMQuote from: Xal0lex on May 09, 2023, 07:13:52 AMQuote from: shahzadafzal on May 09, 2023, 07:06:35 AMWhich language is it?English  English? From which country that such old words are still used in this present days? Then what do you say? In what language do you think this phrase is written? Enlighten me, illiterate  Here, even the all-powerful and all-knowing ChatGPT tells us that this phrase is written in English. Are you going to argue with the AI himself? AddedHere's what Bard (the brainchild of Google) tells us:Will you argue with him, too?

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on May 10, 2023, 04:48:41 PMQuote from: Xal0lex on May 09, 2023, 07:13:52 AMQuote from: shahzadafzal on May 09, 2023, 07:06:35 AMWhich language is it?English  English? From which country that such old words are still used in this present days? It's worth mentioning that SMF is a really old piece of software, dating back to the last century, or possibly around the turn of the new century, if my memory serves me right.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: FatFork on May 11, 2023, 07:33:47 AMQuote from: Agbe on May 10, 2023, 04:48:41 PMQuote from: Xal0lex on May 09, 2023, 07:13:52 AMQuote from: shahzadafzal on May 09, 2023, 07:06:35 AMWhich language is it?English  English? From which country that such old words are still used in this present days? It's worth mentioning that SMF is a really old piece of software, dating back to the last century, or possibly around the turn of the new century, if my memory serves me right.  No, SMF was already created in the 21st century. If you scroll to the bottom of the forum page, you will see the dates. The year of the first version of SMF software is listed there. The first version of the software was released on December 2, 2006. There is an article on SMF on Wikipedia. You can read it here.

comments.author: UserU
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on May 10, 2023, 04:48:41 PM But this not English Language, When I saw the topic I was even thinking that you are taken about some sort of foreign language or user names and unknown to me that, you are talking of codes. Well it was a nice tour from your site as the one of the forum engineers. It anyone who can interprete the words to English language, it will be a great help to the none native speakers in the forum. Is it that "I am the administrator" is the meaning?They are from old English. And yes, English has evolved as well. An example would be thou, which is the present you in old English.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: Xal0lex on May 11, 2023, 08:32:29 AMQuote from: FatFork on May 11, 2023, 07:33:47 AMQuote from: Agbe on May 10, 2023, 04:48:41 PMQuote from: Xal0lex on May 09, 2023, 07:13:52 AMQuote from: shahzadafzal on May 09, 2023, 07:06:35 AMWhich language is it?English  English? From which country that such old words are still used in this present days? It's worth mentioning that SMF is a really old piece of software, dating back to the last century, or possibly around the turn of the new century, if my memory serves me right.  No, SMF was already created in the 21st century. If you scroll to the bottom of the forum page, you will see the dates. The year of the first version of SMF software is listed there. The first version of the software was released on December 2, 2006. There is an article on SMF on Wikipedia. You can read it here.Yeah, I missed it by a few years. I recall playing around with some open-source forum software during that time, and it's possible that I mixed up SMF with phpBB, which was quite popular back then. However, based on the information in the wiki article, the first version of SMF, which was SMF 1.0 Beta 1a, was actually released in September 2003. But you're right, the first stable version, SMF 1.1, was released in 2006.But it's still a relic of the past - an outdated piece of software that hasn't changed much since then. It's amusing to consider that most of the current members of the BitcoinTalk.org forum weren't even born when SMF first came into being.

comments.author: shahzadafzal
comments.created_time: May 11, 2023, 09:43:01 AMLast edit: May 11, 2023, 11:19:21 AM by shahzadafzal

comments.author: Igebotz
comments.body: Quote from: shahzadafzal on May 11, 2023, 09:43:01 AMi am the administrator. Hasn't been implemented yet and I don't think it would anytime soon. Lucky you. Quote from: FatFork on May 11, 2023, 09:06:13 AMBut it's still a relic of the past - an outdated piece of software that hasn't changed much since then. It's amusing to consider that most of the current members of the BitcoinTalk.org forum weren't even born when SMF first came into being.Thought BTT has the most older members than other crypto forums I know it's impossible to collect the age data since everyone is using fake DOB but do we really have much under 25 here? Average should be above 40 or something.

comments.author: shahzadafzal
comments.body: I found a way to bypass this check but I'm not sure if its ok to post it here

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Quote from: Xal0lex on May 11, 2023, 05:34:15 AMThen what do you say? In what language do you think this phrase is written? Enlighten me, illiterate  Here, even the all-powerful and all-knowing ChatGPT tells us that this phrase is written in English. Are you going to argue with the AI himself?  In the L2 countries English words are not from origin but study in schools and for personal studies in the English Dictionaries. That is we know most words from secondary sources. So if I have not seen or heard about such words from my end should not be a term of "illiteracy". Learning is continues. I just tap my English Dictionary and saw the meaning of the words under discussion.
